text.name: sys_description
text.text: Super Nintendo, known as the Super Famicom in Japan, is a video game console marketed by the Japanese Nintendo in late November 1990. In North America, the console output with a decidedly different look and is more precisely called Super Nintendo Entertainment System (or SNES). The Super Nintendo console generation 16-bit output to counter the Sega Megadrive (16 bits) and to a lesser extent the NEC PC-Engine and the Neo-Geo AES SNK (16 bits). The Satellaview, or BS-X, was released in 1995 on Japan to download exclusive satellite games on the St.GIGA network.
